greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the reversals of the proper divisors of n.
link: Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..50000
example: The proper divisors of 20 are 1,2,4,5,10, which reversed are 1,2,4,5,1, summing to 13. Therefore a(10) = 13.
mathematica: f[n_] := FromDigits[Reverse[IntegerDigits[n]]]; g[n_] := Apply[Plus, Map[f, Drop[Divisors[n], -1]]]; Table[g[i], {i, 1, 40}]
Table[Total[IntegerReverse/@Most[Divisors[n]]],{n,100}] (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 04 2021 *)
results.author: _Joseph L. Pe_, Apr 19 2002
ext: More terms from _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 19 2013
